Description: "Arab Standing in Prayer," shows an aged man on a prayer mat with his eyes uplifted and his hands open in a gesture of intense devotion. The drawing is related to one of Gérôme's most successful compositions, the painting "Prayer on the Rooftops," (Hamburg, Kunsthalle), on which he worked in the early 1860s and which he showed at the Salon of 1865. Gérôme represented a group of men on a rooftop in Cairo at sunset, all facing east in prayer and all at different stages in their worship, with some standing, some seated, and some prostrate against the sky and minarets behind.

Exhibitions.Textblock: A Discerning Eye: Nineteenth-century Drawings and Watercolors. Academy Art Museum, Easton. 1998-1999.

Exhibitions.Textblock: Botanical Delights: Floral Motifs in 19th-Century Art. Government House, Annapolis; Strathmore Hall Art Center, North Bethesda; Academy Art Museum, Easton. 1998-1999.

Inscriptions: "à M. Walters/J.L. Gérôme 1864" in graphite, center right
Medium: graphite on cream, moderately thick, slightly textured wove paper
Provenance: William T. Walters, Baltimore, 1864, by purchase [from the artist];  Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1894, by inheritance;  Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Arab Standing in Prayer
